page.title: 06ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH
page.content:
{
There was a ruined Saxon church here when the Domesday Survey was made in 1086. The name of the church before 1786 was St Mary's Church but in 1786 it was changed to St Andrew's. The church which has been modified mamy times dates from the Norman period. At one time it had a minstrel gallery in the west end. Notable features include the dovecote which a former rector built in the tower. This has now been sealed up to prevent damage to the clock. There is a peal of six bells- the oldest bell dates from 14 . On the chancel wall there is a tablet dedicated to the Seymour family.
